title: 10 asteroids named to honour ESA’s role in Planetary Defence
ESA Adjusts Scope of Phase 2 of its LEO Cargo Return Services Initiative
summary:
The European Space Agency (ESA) has adjusted the scope of Phase 2 of its LEO Cargo Return Services programme to account for the retirement of the International Space Station (ISS). Under the new call, the agency will accept proposals for demonstration missions to a future commercial LEO destination by the end of 2030. ESA announced […]
The post ESA Adjusts Scope of Phase 2 of its LEO Cargo Return Services Initiative appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: 2026 will be the year of space nuclear power and surviving the lunar night

authors.name: Tyler Bernstein, A.C. Charania and Alex Gilbert

summary:
Lunar night survival becomes an imperative “Surviving the lunar night has crossed a critical threshold: what was once a ‘nice-to-have’ is now the imperative for any serious lunar mission. We’re seeing this ‘survive, operate, thrive’ progression play out in real time: we’ve proven we can land repeatedly, now we’re focused on surviving that brutal two-week […]
The post 2026 will be the year of space nuclear power and surviving the lunar night appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Eutelsat orders 340 additional satellites to replenish OneWeb constellation
summary:
Eutelsat has ordered the remaining 340 satellites needed to replenish its OneWeb satellite constellation from Airbus Defence and Space.

title: NASA’s Webb Delivers Unprecedented Look Into Heart of Circinus Galaxy
summary: The Circinus Galaxy, a galaxy about 13 million light-years away, contains an active supermassive black hole that continues to influence its evolution. The largest source of infrared light from the region closest to the black hole itself was thought to be outflows, or streams of superheated matter that fire outward.  Image: Circinus Galaxy (Hubble and […]

title: ATD water-cooled throttleable engine firing
summary: Romanian company ATD Aerospace RS SRL is developing a 10 kN rocket engine that can be re-ignited and adjust its thrust. This builds on the 1 kN engine they developed with support from the European Space Agency (ESA).

title: A Plume of Bright Blue in Melissa’s Wake
summary: The category 5 hurricane stirred up carbonate sediment near Jamaica in what scientists believe is the largest such event in the satellite record.

title: Artemis Accords Reach Another Milestone with Portugal
